title: Team Config
description: Schema for an A1 Engineer team configuration file.

$schema.description: JSON Schema reference. Allowed so IDE tooling can include $schema in config files without failing validation.

name.description: Team name. Used as suffix for compose services: ergo-{name}, net-{name}, agent-{name}-{role}.

repo.description: Repository to clone into the team's git volume.

branch.description: Branch to check out. Defaults to 'main'.

role.description: Agent role. Maps to IRC_ROLE env var. Nick derived at runtime as {name}-{role} (with suffix for duplicates).

model.description: Claude model to use. Passed as CLAUDE_MODEL env var.

effort.description: Thinking effort level. TODO: wire through as CLAUDE_EFFORT env var once Claude Code consumption is confirmed.

github.description: GitHub App credentials for scoped repo access. If omitted, falls back to GITHUB_TOKEN env var (PAT mode).

appId.description: GitHub App ID (numeric). Can also be set via GITHUB_APP_ID env var.

installationId.description: GitHub App Installation ID for the target repo/org. Can also be set via GITHUB_INSTALLATION_ID env var.

privateKeyPath.description: Path to the GitHub App private key PEM file. Can also be set via GITHUB_APP_PRIVATE_KEY_PATH env var.

ergo.description: Optional Ergo IRC server configuration. Defaults are sufficient for local dev.

image.description: Docker image for the Ergo IRC server.

configPath.description: Host path to ircd.yaml to bind-mount into the container.

port.description: IRC port exposed on the internal Docker network.

hostPort.description: Host port to expose for direct IRC client access (e.g., Halloy). If set, Ergo is reachable at localhost:<hostPort>. Omit to keep IRC internal-only.
